description: A stunning tropical plant with large, glossy leaves that develop natural splits and holes as they mature. Known as the Swiss Cheese Plant for its distinctive fenestrations.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water when top 2 inches of soil are dry. Prefers humidity above 60%.

description: A hardy succulent with striking sword-shaped leaves featuring beautiful variegated patterns. One of the most tolerant houseplants.
careInstructions: Tolerates low light, water sparingly every 2-3 weeks. Drought tolerant and nearly indestructible.

description: An elegant tree with large, violin-shaped leaves. A statement plant that adds architectural interest to any space.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water when top inch of soil is dry. Rotate regularly for even growth.

description: A versatile trailing vine with heart-shaped leaves in golden-green hues. Perfect for hanging baskets or climbing poles.
careInstructions: Low to bright indirect light, water when soil feels dry. Very forgiving and easy to propagate.

description: A tropical beauty with large paddle-shaped leaves and exotic orange and blue flowers resembling a bird in flight.
careInstructions: Bright direct light, water thoroughly when top 2 inches are dry. Requires space to grow.

description: An elegant plant with glossy dark green leaves and distinctive white spathes. Known for its air-purifying qualities.
careInstructions: Low to medium light, keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Wilts when thirsty.

description: A bold plant with large, thick, glossy leaves in deep burgundy or green. Makes an impressive floor plant.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water when top inch is dry. Wipe leaves regularly to remove dust.

description: A lush, feathery fern with gracefully arching fronds. Classic Victorian-era houseplant with timeless appeal.
careInstructions: Indirect light, keep soil consistently moist. Requires high humidity and regular misting.

description: A succulent with thick, woody stems and oval-shaped jade green leaves. Symbol of good luck and prosperity.
careInstructions: Bright light with some direct sun, water sparingly. Let soil dry completely between waterings.

description: A prayer plant with stunning oval leaves featuring intricate patterns in green, white, and deep purple. Leaves fold up at night.
careInstructions: Medium to low indirect light, keep soil moist. Requires high humidity and filtered water.

description: A medicinal succulent with thick, fleshy leaves containing soothing gel. Both decorative and practical.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water deeply but infrequently. Drought tolerant desert plant.

description: A resilient plant with arching variegated leaves and cascading baby plantlets. Excellent air purifier.
careInstructions: Medium to bright indirect light, water regularly. Produces babies that can be propagated.

description: A modern architectural plant with glossy, dark green pinnate leaves on thick stems. Virtually indestructible.
careInstructions: Low to bright indirect light, water only when soil is completely dry. Extremely drought tolerant.

description: An aromatic herb with slender silvery-green foliage and fragrant purple flower spikes. Beloved by pollinators.
careInstructions: Full sun, well-draining soil. Water moderately, allowing soil to dry between waterings.

description: A charming plant with distinctive round, coin-shaped leaves on delicate stems. Modern Scandinavian favorite.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water when top inch is dry. Rotate weekly for even growth and produces pups.

description: A charming plant with distinctive round, coin-shaped leaves on delicate stems. Modern Scandinavian favorite.
careInstructions: Bright indirect light, water when top inch is dry. Rotate weekly for even growth and produces pups.
